docs.snippet: Nearly a year after the Obama administration launched a massive public relations campaign to dispel rumors of a free pass for immigrant families crossing the border illegally, internal intelligence files from the Homeland Security Department sugge...
docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly a year after the Obama administration launched a massive public relations campaign to dispel rumors of a free pass for immigrant families crossing the border illegally, internal intelligence files from the Homeland Security Department suggest that effort is failing.

headline.main: Immigrants Caught at Border Believe Families Can Stay in US
headline.print_headline: Immigrants Caught at Border Believe Families Can Stay in US

docs.snippet: A 35-year-old man with an extensive criminal record was charged on Friday in connection with a string of suspected arson fires at St. Louis-area churches, police said....
docs.lead_paragraph: A 35-year-old man with an extensive criminal record was charged on Friday in connection with a string of suspected arson fires at St. Louis-area churches, police said.

headline.main: Man Charged in St. Louis Area Church Fires
headline.print_headline: Man Charged in St. Louis Area Church Fires

docs.snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton, shouting over protesters, promised black Americans Friday that she would address systemic racism and, if elected, follow in the footsteps of her predecessor, the country's first black president....

headline.main: Clinton Faces Protests as She Courts Black Voters
headline.print_headline: Clinton Faces Protests as She Courts Black Voters

docs.snippet: A Saudi who emerged as a defiant leader among prisoners during nearly 14 years of confinement on the U.S. base at Guantanamo Bay in Cuba has been released to join his family in Britain....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Saudi who emerged as a defiant leader among prisoners during nearly 14 years of confinement on the U.S. base at Guantanamo Bay in Cuba has been released to join his family in Britain.

headline.main: Last UK Detainee at Guantanamo Is Released
headline.print_headline: Last UK Detainee at Guantanamo Is Released

docs.snippet: The lack of concern for survivors of a fire that killed 10 people known as Travelers is a recent example of Irish prejudice against the group that has roamed there for centuries....
docs.lead_paragraph: The lack of concern for survivors of a fire that killed 10 people known as Travelers is a recent example of Irish prejudice against the group that has roamed there for centuries.
docs.abstract: Survivors of Carrickmines, Ireland, fire that killed 10 people from group know as Travelers remain outcast from Irish society despite tragedy; Travelers, which are small minority in Ireland, are generally nomadic group that many associate with criminal activity and antisocial behavior.

headline.main: Sympathy Is Short-Lived for Irish Minority Group After Deadly Fire
headline.print_headline: Sympathy Is Short-Lived for Marginalized Irish After a Deadly Fire

docs.snippet: Mr. Bronstein spent the early part of his career as a civil rights lawyer seeking to defy Jim Crow culture, and he later directed the American Civil Liberties Union’s National Prison Project for 25 years....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Bronstein spent the early part of his career as a civil rights lawyer seeking to defy Jim Crow culture, and he later directed the American Civil Liberties Union’s National Prison Project for 25 years.
docs.abstract: Alvin Bronstein, civil rights lawyer and director of American Civil Liberties Union’s National Prison Project for 25 years, who fought for prison reform to protect growing American inmate population from abusive conditions, dies at age 87.

headline.main: Alvin Bronstein, Lawyer Who Fought Prison Abuse, Dies at 87
headline.print_headline: Alvin Bronstein, Lawyer Who Fought Prison Abuse, Dies at 87

docs.snippet: Ms. Crosley, a writer with a following, invented a secret alter ego when she had two quite different books coming out in quick succession....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ms. Crosley, a writer with a following, invented a secret alter ego when she had two quite different books coming out in quick succession.
docs.abstract: Essayist and author Sloane Crosley, whose just-published novel The Clasp was promoted as her first, reveals that she had previously co-wrote romantic comedy Read Bottom Up under pen name Skye Chatham.

headline.main: Sloane Crosley Unclasps Cloak of Secrecy About Authorship
headline.print_headline: Novelist Decides to Kill Off a Persona That Has Outlived Its Purpose
